thread.title: 5 epic moments that prove Lincoln City have incredible fans as the Imps book spot in quarter-finals of FA Cup
thread.title_full: 5 epic moments that prove Lincoln City have incredible fans as the Imps book spot in quarter-finals of FA Cup

author: Jake Polden
title: 5 epic moments that prove Lincoln City have incredible fans as the Imps book spot in quarter-finals of FA Cup
text:
Get football   Could   
The Imps are in dreamland. 
After beating Premier League outfit Burnley at Turf Moor, lowly conference side Lincoln City are in the quarter-final of the FA Cup. 
They're the first non-league side to reach this stage of competition since 1914, and well, don't the supporters deserve it? 
The above video is a compilation of the Imps fans enjoying some of the best moments of their historical cup run so far, and it really is what the tournament is all about. Lincoln City fans made themselves heard at Turf Moor (Photo: Getty Images) Imps fans are already dreaming of FA Cup glory (Photo: Clive Brunskill) 
After beating Guiseley in an FA Cup qualifying fourth round match, Lincoln dispatched Altrincham, Oldham Athletic, Ipswich, Brighton and Burnley. 
Ahead of the Ipswich game - their first match with a Championship team - the Imps fans were filmed queuing in huge numbers to get hold of a ticket. 
They later put on quite the show as they celebrated in the streets ahead of their replay, which they won 1-0 following a 2-2 draw at Portman Road. Lincoln players celebrate their unlikely win over Brighton (Photo: Getty) Lincoln celebrate after beating Ipswich in the third round of the cup (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 
Drawing Brighton in the fourth round - a second Championship side - led to more elation from the fans, who celebrated the chance to host the Seagulls like they'd already won the cup. 
The draw led to an even bigger turn out of supporters, desperate to nab a ticket, queuing up outside the ground, as you can see in the above clip. 
And finally, what other way would there be to finish the compilation video than the reaction from fans as they beat Premier League outfit Burnley to reach the quarter-finals? Brilliant. poll loading Can Lincoln WIN the FA Cup? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
